Chris L
\xbd January 13
column2:
2018
This is very heart wrenching to say this
column3:
about something I have beloved so dearly since a young child. Last Jedi is the absolute worst SW\'s movie in the history of the franchise.

I don\'t even know where to begin. Everything from the bizarre
column5: to the uneventful backstory of both Snoke and Rey
column8: to the unsexy weird love triangle between Finn
column10: and Rose. The comic relief was cringy at best
column11: and anyone over the age of 25
column12:
could easily see a huge leftist political agenda being shoved down the throats of the audience.

The artwork and the special effects in TLJ
column13:
are nothing short of spectacularly beautiful. The action sequences are nothing short of thrillingly fantastic. Hats off to Rian Johnson and the art/special effects team for delivering a visual masterpiece.

What TLJ makes up for in art and action
column14: it\'s lack of depth and emotion are about as shallow as the Gobi desert in mid summer. Sure the movie is a thrill ride
column15: but there\'s no guys and glory. There\'s nothing fantastic
column16: nothing magical and mysterious leading you up to the drop off
column17:
instead it just immediately drops off.

It would be the equivalent of going to an amusement park and the every ride you get on just immediately drops to second you sit down. There\'s no long pull upwards looking down at your possible impending doom
column18: there\'s no looking around at the majestic world around you to get caught up in
column19: as you begin to feel like a God climbing to the heavens above. There\'s no dragging you and any of the characters through the "muck". Therefore you don\'t get emotionally attached to any of the characters in TLJ
column20: I never once felt despair or pain
column22:
or happiness and joy for anyone.

Infact the only two emotions I could muster up the entire film
column23: was anger and frustration at the writers
column25: and producers of this poorly crafted film. I guess you could say Rian Johnson really brought the "Darkside" out me. I\'m not sure if that\'s a good thing
column26:
considering I had high hopes for this trilogy.

My 8 and 5 year old children could have told a better story. I could have written and produced a more emotionally in-depth movie
column27: and I know countless of other Star Wars fans who could have did it even better than myself. Rian Johnson deserves the credit he gets
column28:
which is for making something pretty to look at. Everything else is just a travesty. I would advise anyone who is a long time SW\'s fan to save your hard earned dollars if you don\'t want to see your dreams shot down in flames. Which brings me to another point.

I understand they want to do away with the old and bring about the new
column29: and I\'m perfectly fine with that as long as it\'s done the correct way. However
column30: it wasn\'t done the correct and honest way. It was done as a quick cash grab
column31: which is aggravating. There was no homage paid to Luke
column32: or any of the old heroes. Where was the lightsaber battle for Luke? What the heck happened to his hope? You can\'t get me to believe? that Kylo Ren
column33: who at best a lesser powerful Darth Maul
column34: could turn the most hopeful Jedi in the galaxy
column35: into a despaired hopeless hermit. You\'re talking about the guy you turned one of the most powerful and evil sith lord
column36:
back to the light side.

I didn\'t have a problem with the astral projection tie in with the force. I thought it was a cool idea
column37: yet it was poorly executed. I also have a problem with Rey and her unmatched skills. You\'re telling me that an amateur at best
column38: beats Kylo Ren? Which is why I can\'t take Kylo Ren serious
column39: and why I say he\'s at best a lesser powerful Darth Maul. You also make her best
column40: Luke??? Why don\'t you just go ahead and hand her the victory on a silver platter
column41: and hand Kylo Ren a trophy for participation... Rey is like a Jedi God
column43: she has no trouble but only triumph. I want to see her suffer
column44: so I can feel for her character
column45: I want to love Rey as a hero. I want to go through her pain and tragedy
column46:
and her joy and victory.

What was up with the casino scene? That whole gimmick was just a terrible time filler
column47: which could have been used to show Luke training Rey! That whole casino scene was probably one of the worst scenes in the history of cinematography. Totally unnecessary
column49: where do you even start with this guy? Wow
column50: what a let down. We wait two years and all we get is about 15 minutes of an old man in a golden bath robe
column51: showing off extremely powerful skills only to be cut in half? Where\'s his backstory? Who the heck was he
column52:
and how did he rise to power after Vader and Sidious died?

There were so many really good angles they could have took when dealing with Snoke. What about the Darth Plagueis theory? What about the Jar Jar Binks sith Lord theory and tying in the prequels? What about the theory about Snoke being a master of both the light and dark? Why were all of these awesome theories
column53:
just brushed aside like nothing matters?

The Last Jedi
column54: had the potential to be the best SW\'s movie ever
column55: it had the chance to the everything together
column56: and it fell short due to whatever insane reasons Rian Johnson had in mind. The Star Wars franchise was a franchise
column57:
that seemed like it would be impossible to ever drop the ball with. However that\'s exactly what was done here.

What\'s sad
column58: is not only did Disney drop the ball
column59: they might as well just destroyed the franchise. Maybe they\'re? looking to appeal to the younger generation
column60: but they could have still done that and interwoven the old heroes in with the new
column61:
while eventually passing the torch.

What Disney and Rian Johnson did to Star Wars

column69:
awful new characters...it\'s horrible.
Luke has been reduced to a comedy character and what made Ep VII so enjoyable was non-existent here.
It\'s over-long and ultimately just the most pointless entry in the whole series.
Hux becoming a comedy character.
Luke becoming a parody of himself.
Feminist agenda bullshit.
SuperLeia.
Rey\'s parentage.
Rey just being powerful to balance the force...!?
Luke going away to die...but leaving a map behind.
The whole Fin/Rose subplot.
Laura Dern\'s pointless character.
Po: Hero to Zero.
A tiny
column71:
resitance even after blowing up Starkiller base.
Phasma wasted.
Snoke wasted.
Snoke\'s stupid death.
The stupid reason for Luke to kill Ben.
...that\'s just a few of the reasons this film sucks. '

Disney KNOW they\'re in trouble. Thats why they\'re doing damage control here on RT and other sites.

Yes
column84: Last Jedi made them an easy Billion but in the long term
column85:
they\'ve irreparably damaged their most valuable brand.
After all
column86:
are YOU planning to see the "Han Solo Spinoff"? Or Episode 9 for that matter??

And consider this:
- Its 2nd week box office plunge\xa0is the worst in history.
- It set a new record for biggest ever sequel-to-sequel box office decline.
- In Hollywood\'s largest overseas market (China) it opened to less than half its predecessor\'s opening
column87:
then plunged 94% after the 1st week.
- Its audience score on this site is 10% lower than Phantom Menace and by far the lowest in the saga... and thats with RT helping it!
- A petition demanding it \'struck from canon\' has 85
column88:
000 signatures.
- And now they\'re predicting a Han Solo movie flop!

Star Wars IS DEAD! '

Outside of \'Attack of the Clones\' this was the most disappointing Star Wars film
column95: we have Snoke who has really not been mentioned before
column96:
but now is in charge of everything? OK was left wondering on that.
Next
column97: with Carrie Fisher no longer with us
column98:
they missed a chance to write Leia out of the film. Instead there was a convoluted and unnecessary "recovery" in space to survive and return to the ship?
I was less-than-impressed with Mark Hammill\'s acting performance
column99:
I mean can we now see why he basically hasn\'t worked in 40 years?
Finally
column100: not sure why Star Wars writers/producers insist on the Empire always having some *one* glaring vulnerability for the Rebellion to go after. Like the tracker
column101: they only have ONE? Seems like they would have an unlimited budget based on the staggering amount of ships
column103:
but that is where they cheap out?
For that matter
column104: why is the Empire so lacking in any kind of tactical skills? I mean
column105: one ship attacking at the end
column106:
with no other ones anywhere to be found just in case an escape is made?
And why did they insist on adding the "cutesie" little Porgs in the most annoying way? OK I get they\'re trying to maybe hold little kids\' attention or work on fattening up the film\'s merchandising potential
column107:
but didn\'t have to lay it on so thick with those things.
I don\'t deny there weren\'t some good moments
column108: the special effects were on-point as always. But overall this one really did not grab me as others have. '

This film will age horribly. The politics are far too current and on-the-nose
column111: which practically spells disaster even in the short term. The plot holes are gaping and utterly distracting around every turn. The subversion for the sake of castrating adult male nerds who adore the franchise was a bold decision in the sense that it was a monumental mistake. Classic cinema lives on as generations make way to new ones
column112: which means we need our nerdy dads and moms and aunts and uncles to show us what is great. And there\'s no way in hell im showing this to my son or daughter in the future. What would i say to them? "Hey kids
column114: this is a fun ride that teaches you about constant failure and that\'s life
column116: unless you only take lessons from your mother and female figures
column117: then you\'ll be ok in the end
column118: although most people around you won\'t matter at all. Matter of fact
column120: what does it matter anyway? We\'re all just a drop in the pond
column121: so dont try to elevate who you are as a human being
column122: because its a waste in the bigger picture." I honestly feel sorry for the parents who took their ten-year-olds to see this. In Star Wars
column123: they should be able to witness the construction of a hero
column124: not the rapid deconstruction of a villain who murdered his father. Anyway I digress... My assumption is that Johnson brought a solid foundation of ideas but was quickly swallowed up by the sudden iron fist of feminist hollywood currently dethroning and defaming any male who refuses to conform. He is now digesting slowly in Disney\'s sarlacc pit of despair and i wouldn\'t hesitate to doubt that we will never again see an interesting film out of Rian Johnson. '

I didn\'t so much mind the long run time
column131: but I did notice it. It was interesting
column132: with action scenes that had plenty of dramatic impact. There were a few rather gaping plot holes that I thought about only after it was over. People are bashing this film because it didn\'t cater to their fan theories
column133: or a purple haired woman was in charge of the Rebellion. Frankly those complaints are childish and miss the point. This is unlike any other Star Wars movie
column134:
but it is definitely a Star Wars movie.

It\'s not without its flaws. There\'s an entire gambit that our heroes go on that results in absolutely nothing lost or gained. There\'s a sense that there are no stakes
column135: since every character that dies is inconsequential. There\'s also a sense of breaking with tradition in the Jedi order itself
column136: that many fans probably didn\'t like. I get where this complaint is coming from
column137: but I kind of want to see where they go from here. Enjoyable

It\'s not lacking in budget

column151: and none of the plot threads from the previous film are followed up on. The best chance JJ Abrams has of salvaging this trilogy is to excise this film from the Star Wars canon and make his own Episode VIII. '
